content: North American Telugu Society (NATS) is a non-profit organization formed in 2009 by 200 volunteers with the goal of serving the Telugu community across North America. The organization aims to promote Telugu culture, heritage, and values through cultural, spiritual, social, and educational activities. NATS has a 24/7 helpline service and bi-annually conducts a 3-day convention attended by approximately 8000 people. The convention includes cultural, literary, business symposiums, shark tanks, continuing education classes, women's forums, and career development events for the younger generation. NATS invites prominent dignitaries and leaders to attend the event and has honored them with Lifetime Achievement Awards in the past.
